importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news announcement about Doug Martin's death, indicating when the public learned of his passing.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, from his draft in 2012 through the end of his career in 2018.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was drafted 31st overall in the first round of the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He rushed for 1,454 yards and 11 touchdowns as a rookie, earning a Pro Bowl berth.
Martin achieved 1,402 yards and six touchdowns in 2015, earning a Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro selection.
He finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
His family confirmed his death on October 19, 2025, stating the cause is unconfirmed.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers expressed deep sadness over his passing, calling it a significant loss to the franchise.
Martin was named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during the team’s 50th anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors. He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th anniversary celebration. The team and his family expressed deep sorrow over his passing, which occurred on October 19, 2025, with the cause of death still unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
